comments.commentBody: It's a multi-dimensional problem.  Jobs and a strong social safety net are part of the answer.  So are infrastructure and other investment.  Happily, investment on infrastructure creates jobs.  The answers are not mutually exclusive.
So??

Just because people don't view the word "socialism" unfavorably doesn't mean that Democrats have become socialists in disguise. It only means that ever increasing swaths of the populace are learning to no longer howl when they hear the conservative dog whistle of "socialist!" Think that wealth inequality is destabilizing our country, and suddenly the right shrieks "socialist!" Well, it's not working any more, and that's all that the above stats show.

Oh, and the Nazi fascism you reference was an extreme right wing horror focused on blaming minorities and Marxists for all of their problems, a horror that threatened all that was good in the world. So as long as you want to associate all extreme left-wing movements with Democrats, let's not let you self-righteous Republicans forget that.
Where do you get the idea that Canada bears no responsibility for its defence? We have borne a lot of responsibility for our own and others' defence as well.

Given that the alternative is not having any access to elective surgery, having to wait months is a huge step in the right direction.

Appears that there is a total absence of common sense among so-called conservatives. It is no wonder the right-wing can brain wash so many.

In my book, they are just plain ignorant and very selfish. T

What makes me the most angry is that these are the same people who march to church ever Sunday and claim to be Christians.
Personally, I think Obama won cause women were freaked out that Republicans wanted to stick their nose in American women's vaginas. I guess it is all about perspective.

Thank you for speaking out.

George Washington and Thomas Jefferson were both socialists. Abe Lincoln's "government for the people, by the people" is about as socialist as one can get.

The United States has a mixed economy. As do the majority of "free" countries.

Americans have been so brainwashed by the anti-communism propaganda of the 1950s through present, they are unable to apply common sense to issues.

"...subsidize the many who make other choices."

Poverty is not a choice. It is something that can happen to anyone, in the blink of an eye. All it takes is an accident, a job loss, a hurricane, a flood, a serious illness...

Be careful, you may end up having to eat your words.

all this abstraction is too complex for the average voter. However Romney's adventurous tax returns and comments have brought theory to a level that everyone who wants to understand,  can understand. Now we see how a group of deal makers can sell out workers, use the tax system to enrich themselves. In short, the GOP made a gigantic error in settling on Mitt, since he has opened the closed box of how the rich became and continue to be very rich, and who have taken the livelihood  away from the workers

So, what you're saying is that those who risk it all to build and run a business (you obviously have no clue what "liability" means), earn or inherit a fortune, provide opportunities for people to earn a living and ask a price for all of his risk and effort can only do so because the rest of us won't bash is head in?
Poverty WILL cease to exist...but only because the term will apply to everyone. At that point we'll all be equal, not poor.

Laissez faire Capitalism has never existed. Ever.

Limbaugh is most definitely NOT an admirer of Ayn Rand (she would be revolted by the thought).

Socialism is not a floating abstraction...its a reality that has destroyed societies and killed millions world wide.

I voted for Obama to hasten the inevitable result; all societies that accept the political expression of self-sacrifice end up killing themselves. Its a historical fact.

Actually, the USSR was a corrupt version of totalitarianism.

Just because someone calls it "socialism" doesn't mean it is.

"They bear no responsibility for armed defense of their countries," you say?

That simply isn't true. They all have militaries, they just don't spend the lion's share of their countries resources on them, like we do! Our military expenditures are insane, and we all know it's simple about the MONEY! Nothing else.
Just so long as he doesn't come here -- Australia!  Where we have universal health care, no guns, no death penalty, and the prime minister is an unmarried atheist woman.
Half of all U.S. workers earned less than $26,364 in 2010  ---  the lowest median wage since 1999, adjusted for inflation.  —Washington Post

The Cuban embargo has proven to be one of the worse fiascos of American foreign policy. 50 years later, it has only provided unnecessary hardship and resentment to the Cuban people while empowering the Castro regime. Of course, republicans are so short -sighted and retrograded as to insist on such a tyrannical blockade.
Yes, those twins are just poor, innocent, naive victims--and as Dowd says, like Austen's patriotic Lydia keen to support the troops.
Well, Maureen did refer  her readers to Pride and Prejudice, a book in which the military man, Wickham, is also painted in a pretty unflattering light.

I agree, somewhat. However, these women quite frankly give all the rest of us women a bad name. I for one have NO sympathy for them. I think they thought they would gain something here, not sure yet what exactly that is besides $80M in "commissions", but I would not be surprised to find both on reality TV in the next year or so.

This is the sickness of our entire country - these people end up as "celebrities", are taken seriously and have national press conferences all to talk about how they cook or what sport they play. Who cares? Well, apparently, enough of us here in the dumbed down USA do care, otherwise we would not even be discussing these "ladies".

the dangers of young ladies with exuberant, flirtatious, “unguarded and imprudent” manners visiting military regiments and preening in “all the glories of the camp.”
****
I am appalled at you, Ms Dowd, for insinuating that the women are to blame for the generals' own lascivious tendencies. Why, you sound as apologetic as McCain (who Charlie Pierce categorizes as post-menopausal), Lindsay Graham (I am tough too, look at me), and Peter King (panderer in chief) on how sad it is that Petraeus allowed himself to be led by 'little Petraeus' than he did matters of the Republic.

You have company, too, you know. You are right there with Pat Robertson who rationalized Petraeus' behavior thus:

"Who knows? The man's off in a foreign land and he's lonely and here's a good looking lady throwing herself at him. I mean, he's a man."

And yet, as we speak, there are now three top generals mired in sexual controversy. http://goo.gl/VjhcZ
Shame on you for putting this on the women!

There are certain members of the 1% who voted for Romney and the Republicans because they want STUFF.  In fact, most, if not all of Romney's votes were from people who wanted stuff.  It was their own SPECIAL kind of stuff.
So would Lincoln.

It is probably just as well, because they do not know that behind the lie that is American capitalism stands an elitist plutocracy. A plutocracy that ensures that there are no jobs for degreed applicants by sending such jobs off-shore.
Bush was an idiot controlled by greedy profiteers so what's your point?

And what about those who pay those 'hidden' taxes, but have no share of your so-called pie?  Who lobbies a better deal for them?  If the America of our founding is indeed gone (and parts of that are far better to be gone, in my opinion), then let's continue to create that more perfect union where everyone has a chance at a piece of the pie.
In answer to your last question, nothing much, mainly cosmetic stuff.
He's a professional fascist.
